title: Reflected ray from object in front convex mirror

content.question:
An object O is in front of a convex mirror. The focal point of the mirror
 is labeled F and the center of curvature is labeled C. The direction of the reflected ray is correctly illustrated in all of the following
 EXCEPT which diagram?

choices.label: Option A. A diagram shows an object O in front of a convex mirror. It is depicted with a short upward arrow perpendicular to a horizontal line, that is, the central axis, which passes through the mirror. The focal point of the mirror, labeled F, and the center of curvature, labeled C, are marked behind the mirror, along the central axis. An incident ray directed from the top of the object toward the center of the mirror, which lies on the central axis, reflects back below the central axis.

Option B has the same setup as in option A. Here, an incident ray directed toward the center of curvature of the mirror, from the top of the object, travels above the central axis, then reflects back along the same path, and extends toward the left.

Option C has the same setup as in option A. Here, an incident ray directed toward the focus, from the top of the object, travels above the central axis, then reflects back along a path parallel to and above the central axis.

Option D has the same setup as in option A. Here, an incident ray directed toward the focus, from the top of the object, travels above the central axis, then reflects back along the same path, and extends toward the left.

A diagram shows an object O in front of a convex mirror. The focal point of the mirror, labeled F, and the center of curvature, labeled C, is shown behind the mirror, along the central axis. The incident ray moves horizontal to the central axis and reflects back upwards. The reflected ray appear to originate from the focus point.

content.answer: Option D has the same setup as in option A. Here, an incident ray directed toward the focus, from the top of the object, travels above the central axis, then reflects back along the same path, and extends toward the left.
